All Packages

  • Package Summary 
    Package Description
    jGame
    JGame is a small, simple framework built with the development of small games in mind.
    jGame.core
    This package is the core of the JGame framework, containing all classes required for building a full game based on the framework.
    jGame.core.entity
    This package contains all classes required for proper construction of any entity and correct updating/rendering.
    jGame.core.entity.event
    Package containing classes responsible for managing collisions between an entity and the walls of the game/another entity.
    jGame.core.launcher
    The main package of the framework, where the entry point for every game (GameLauncher) is located.
    jGame.core.serializable
    This package contains classes responsible for serialization of game states, entities and hud elements, storing important values for later use.
    jGame.core.sound
    Package containing classes responsible for the audio part of the game being developed.
    jGame.core.ui
    This class holds a collection of UI-related classes, such as a displayable window or utility functionality to aid in the process of window-making.
    jGame.core.ui.hud
    This package contains classes responsible for implementing a HUD system, with a central class (UIHud) maintaining a list of elements to be displayed after the game updates.
    jGame.core.ui.hud.fonts  
    jGame.core.utils
    Package containing a set of utility classes that are potentially useful.
    jGame.core.utils.properties
    Package containing utility classes for handling game properties.
    jGame.logging
    Package containing classes suited to message, error or data logging.
